meanings.definition: A discoloration of the skin caused by injury
meanings.sent1: She had a bruise on her arm from bumping into the table.
meanings.sent2: The bruise on his leg turned purple and yellow as it healed.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly showed off her colorful bruise to her friends.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with hues that resembled a bruise.
meanings.sent5: The bruise on the apple made it look unappealing.

meanings.definition: To injure without breaking the skin
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to bruise the fruit when picking it from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The delicate flower petals bruised easily when touched.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bruise his opponent's ego with his sharp words.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism seemed to bruise her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's punch could easily bruise his opponent.

meanings.definition: To damage or spoil the appearance of (something)
meanings.sent1: Please handle the fragile items carefully to avoid bruising them.
meanings.sent2: The careless handling of the painting caused it to bruise along the edges.
meanings.sent3: The rain threatened to bruise the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments seemed to bruise his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The rough handling could easily bruise the delicate fabric.
